data.title: European Historical Economics Society
data.meta_description: European Historical Economics Society Conference. All information about the upcoming EHES Conference
data.text:
EHES Working Papers in Economic History provide a non-exclusive means for Society members to disseminate their research, in all fields of economic history.

In order to submit a potential working paper to the series, you need to be a member of the EHES. To become a member of the EHES, see “Become a Member“.

Potential working papers should be sent to the Editor, Paul Sharp, via this link, who is responsible for deciding whether papers are eligible for inclusion in the series or not. Please note that once accepted your paper will be considered published, and you will not be able to make further changes to your manuscript. Please note that the link will take you to an external site.
